intro: Monanthium uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and wet meadows. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single, spike-like inflorescence bearing small, three-lobed flowers. Monanthium uniflorum is often found in the eastern United States and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
